snippet: Lawmakers are meddling in the affairs of this important financial institution that serves millions of rural women.
abstract: Editorial criticizes government of Bangladeshi Prime Min Sheikh Hasina for considering nationalizing and breaking up the widely admired Grameen Bank, which was founded by Nobel Peace Prize recipient Muhammad Yunus and has pioneered micro-lending to poor women who want to start and grow a business; urges country's lawmakers to reject the plan and stop meddling with this important institution that serves millions of rural women.
lead_paragraph: Lawmakers are meddling in the affairs of this important financial institution that serves millions of rural women.

headline.main: Bangladesh Takes Aim at Grameen Bank
headline.print_headline: Bangladesh Takes Aim at Grameen Bank
